title: Font on a poster
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071205075141im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ISO50---Madrone---6-12-06_6234.jpg)

It’s kind of a common typeface. I see in many occasions. I guess the font in the poster maybe manipulated to fit the poster. All I want to know which font this is with this special angles of the curves.

Thanks in advance.

 [‹ font in a music video](http://web.archive.org/web/20071205075141/http:/typophile.com/node/39733 "Go to previous forum topic") [ID headline typeface / Campaign magazine ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071205075141/http:/typophile.com/node/39562 "Go to next forum topic")
author: mydot2001

comments.content:
Avant Garde Gothic (with alternatives) with those As and W.

[http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=avant+garde+gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20071205075141/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=avant+garde+gothic "http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=avant+garde+gothic")
What do you mean by alternatives? From what I saw on the page you mentioned, it looked normal.

Look here:

[http://www.linotype.com/230105/itcavantgardegothicpromedium-charactermap...](http://web.archive.org/web/20071205075141/http:/www.linotype.com/230105/itcavantgardegothicpromedium-charactermap.html "http://www.linotype.com/230105/itcavantgardegothicpromedium-charactermap.html")

scroll down, and you’ll see all sorts of slanted letters. You want to be careful which version of the font you buy, the basic one has only straight letters.
There are so many ligature. Is there any typeface with the forms of the letters of AGA without ligature?

<cite>Is there any typeface with the forms of the letters of AGA without ligature?</cite>

Well, you don’t _have_ to use them.
